packages.description:
## Package Overview

This package provides listener Basic authentication providers, which can be used to authenticate the provided credentials against a file user store or an LDAP user store, and a client Basic authentication provider, which can be used to authenticate against an external endpoint.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this package, see the below **Functions**. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the following.
* [HTTP Service with Basic Auth File User Store](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-service-with-basic-auth-file-user-store.html)
* [HTTP Service with Basic Auth LDAP User Store](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-service-with-basic-auth-ldap-user-store.html)
* [HTTP Client with Basic Auth Example](https://ballerina.io/learn/by-example/http-client-with-basic-auth.html)

fields.name: username
fields.description: Username for Basic Auth authentication

fields.name: password
fields.description: Password for Basic Auth authentication

records.name: CredentialsConfig
records.description: Represents credentials for Basic Auth authentication.

records.name: FileUserStoreConfig
records.description: Represents the file user store configurations.

fields.name: domainName
fields.description: Unique name to identify the user store

fields.name: connectionUrl
fields.description: Connection URL of the LDAP server

fields.name: connectionName
fields.description: The username used to connect to the LDAP server

fields.name: connectionPassword
fields.description: The password used to connect to the LDAP server

fields.name: userSearchBase
fields.description: DN of the context or object under which the user entries are stored in the LDAP server

fields.name: userEntryObjectClass
fields.description: Object class used to construct user entries

fields.name: userNameAttribute
fields.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry

fields.name: userNameSearchFilter
fields.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular user entry

fields.name: userNameListFilter
fields.description: Filtering criteria for searching user entries in the LDAP server

fields.name: groupSearchBase
fields.description: DN of the context or object under which the group entries are stored in the LDAP server

fields.name: groupEntryObjectClass
fields.description: Object class used to construct group entries

fields.name: groupNameAttribute
fields.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a group entry

fields.name: groupNameSearchFilter
fields.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular group entry

fields.name: groupNameListFilter
fields.description: Filtering criteria for searching group entries in the LDAP server

fields.name: membershipAttribute
fields.description: Define the attribute, which contains the distinguished names (DN) of user objects that are there in a group

fields.name: userRolesCacheEnabled
fields.description: To indicate whether to cache the role list of a user

fields.name: connectionPoolingEnabled
fields.description: Define whether LDAP connection pooling is enabled

fields.name: connectionTimeout
fields.description: Connection timeout (in seconds) when making the initial LDAP connection

fields.name: readTimeout
fields.description: Reading timeout (in seconds) for LDAP operations

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: The SSL configurations for the LDAP client socket. This needs to be configured in order to communicate through LDAPs

records.name: LdapUserStoreConfig
records.description: Represents the configurations that are required for an LDAP user store.

fields.name: cert
fields.description: Configurations associated with the `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for LDAP communication.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username of the authenticated user

fields.name: scopes
fields.description: The scopes of the authenticated user

records.name: UserDetails
records.description: Represents the details of the authenticated user.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided Basic Auth configurations.

returnParameters.description: The generated token or else an `auth:Error` occurred during the validation

methods.name: generateToken
methods.description:
Generates a token for Basic Auth authentication.
```ballerina
string|auth:Error token = provider.generateToken();
```

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided Basic Auth configurations.

returnParameters.description: The generated token or else an `auth:Error` occurred during the validation

otherMethods.name: generateToken
otherMethods.description:
Generates a token for Basic Auth authentication.
```ballerina
string|auth:Error token = provider.generateToken();
```

classes.name: ClientBasicAuthProvider

methods.name: init
methods.description: Provides authentication based on the provided configurations.

returnParameters.description:
`auth:UserDetails` if the authentication is successful, `auth:Error` in case of an error of
authentication failure

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
Authenticate the base64-encoded `username:password` credentials.
```ballerina
auth:UserDetails|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Provides authentication based on the provided configurations.

returnParameters.description:
`auth:UserDetails` if the authentication is successful, `auth:Error` in case of an error of
authentication failure

otherMethods.name: authenticate
otherMethods.description:
Authenticate the base64-encoded `username:password` credentials.
```ballerina
auth:UserDetails|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

classes.name: ListenerFileUserStoreBasicAuthProvider
classes.description:
Represents the file user store based listener Basic Auth provider, which is an implementation of the
`auth:ListenerBasicAuthProvider` object.
```ballerina
 auth:ListenerFileUserStoreBasicAuthProvider provider = new;
 ```
The users are denoted by a section in the Ballerina configurations file. The username, password and the scopes
of a particular user are denoted as keys under the users section as shown below. For multiple users, the complete
section has to be duplicated.
```
[[auth.users]]
username = "alice"
password = "password1"
scopes = ["scope1", "scope2"]
```

methods.name: init
methods.description: Creates an LDAP auth store with the provided configurations.

returnParameters.description:
`auth:UserDetails` if the authentication is successful, `auth:Error` in case of an error of
authentication failure

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description:
Attempts to authenticate the base64-encoded `username:password` credentials.
```ballerina
auth:UserDetails|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Creates an LDAP auth store with the provided configurations.

returnParameters.description:
`auth:UserDetails` if the authentication is successful, `auth:Error` in case of an error of
authentication failure

otherMethods.name: authenticate
otherMethods.description:
Attempts to authenticate the base64-encoded `username:password` credentials.
```ballerina
auth:UserDetails|auth:Error result = provider.authenticate("<credential>");
```

classes.name: ListenerLdapUserStoreBasicAuthProvider
classes.description:
Represents the LDAP based listener Basic Auth provider. This connects to an active directory or an LDAP,
retrieves the necessary user information, and performs authentication and authorization. This is an implementation
of the `auth:ListenerBasicAuthProvider` object.
```ballerina
 auth:LdapUserStoreConfig config = {
     domainName: "ballerina.io",
     connectionURL: "ldap://localhost:389",
     connectionName: "cn=admin,dc=avix,dc=lk"
 };
 auth:ListenerLdapUserStoreBasicAuthProvider provider = new(config);
 ```
A user is denoted by a section in the Ballerina configuration file. The password and the scopes assigned to the user
are denoted as keys under the relevant user section as shown below.
```
[b7a.users.<username>]
password="<password>"
scopes="<comma_separated_scopes>"
```

returnParameters.description:
`auth:UserDetails` if the authentication is successful, `auth:Error` in case of an error of
authentication failure

methods.name: authenticate
methods.description: Authenticates the user based on the user credentials (i.e., the username/password).

objectTypes.name: ListenerBasicAuthProvider
objectTypes.description:
Represents the listener Basic Auth provider, which could be used to authenticate credentials.
The `auth:ListenerBasicAuthProvider` acts as the interface for all the Basic Auth listener authentication providers.
Any type of implementation such as file store, LDAP user store, in memory user store, JDBC user store etc. should be
object-wise similar.

returnParameters.description:
A `string` tuple with the extracted username and password or else an `auth:Error` occurred while
extracting credentials

functions.name: extractUsernameAndPassword
functions.description:
Extracts the username and the password from the base64-encoded `username:password` value.
```ballerina
[string, string]|auth:Error [username, password] = auth:extractUsernameAndPassword("<credential>");
```

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX
constants.description: Prefix used to denote special configuration values.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_ENCRYPTED
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is encrypted.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA256
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-256 hash.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA384
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-384 hash.

constants.name: CONFIG_PREFIX_SHA512
constants.description: Prefix used to denote that the config value is a SHA-512 hash.

constants.name: DEFAULT_CHARSET
constants.description: Default charset to be used with password hashing.

errors.name: Error
errors.description:
Represents the Auth error. This will be returned if an error occurred while any of the listener Basic Auth providers
try to authenticate the received credentials and client Basic Auth provider try to generate the token.
